content.description: The functions f and g are differentiable for all real numbers, and g is strictly increasing. The table above gives values of the functions and their first derivatives at selected values of x. The function h is given by h(x) = f(g(x)) - 6.
content.question: Explain why there must be a value r for 1 < r < 3 such that h(r) = -5.

frqParts.text: Explain why there must be a value r for 1 < r < 3 such that h(r) = -5.

topic.text: 1.16: Working with the Intermediate Value Theorem (IVT)

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Provide reasons or rationales for solutions and conclusions.
